org.purl.wf4ever.wfdesc

Interface Workflow

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Description, Process
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    WorkflowInstance

    public interface Workflow
extends Process
    A wfdesc:Workflow is a directed graph in which the nodes are wfdesc:Process instances and the edges (wfdesc:DataLink instances) represent data dependencies between the constituent wfdesc:Process descriptions. A wfdesc:Workflow defines associated wfdesc:Process using wfdesc:hasSubProcess. A specialisation of this property is wfdesc:hasSubWorkflow, signifying that the process is a wfdesc:Workflow itself, which is further described in a similar fashion. As a subclass of wfdesc:Process a wfdesc:Workflow can also define wfdesc:hasInput/wfdesc:hasOutput parameters - these would be inputs taken at workflow execution time, and final outputs of the workflow. (Note: Not all dataflow systems have this concept of workflow parameters) wfdesc:Parameter descriptions are linked using wfdesc:DataLink descriptions associated with the wfdesc:Workflow using wfdesc:hasDataLink. A wfdesc:Parameter defined with wfdesc:hasInput on a wfdesc:Workflow is considered an wfdesc:Input "outside" the workflow (ie. if it is a subworkflow), but an wfdesc:Output "inside" the workflow (where it can be connected to a wfdesc:Input of a wfdesc:Process). Thus such parameters can be linked "through" the workflow without having a "mirrored" port inside. Example: ##

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<DataLink> getWfHasDataLink()
      This property is used to specify the wfdesc:DataLink instances of a given wfdesc:Workflow.
      Set<Process> getWfHasSubProcess()
      This object property is used to specify that the given workflow contains the given process as part of its definition.
      Set<Workflow> getWfHasSubWorkflow()
      This object property is used to associate a wfdesc:Workflow description to another wfdesc:Workflow, specifying that the first workflow has the given sub-workflow as a contained process.
      void setWfHasDataLink(Set<? extends DataLink> wfHasDataLink)
      This property is used to specify the wfdesc:DataLink instances of a given wfdesc:Workflow.
      void setWfHasSubProcess(Set<? extends Process> wfHasSubProcess)
      This object property is used to specify that the given workflow contains the given process as part of its definition.
      void setWfHasSubWorkflow(Set<? extends Workflow> wfHasSubWorkflow)
      This object property is used to associate a wfdesc:Workflow description to another wfdesc:Workflow, specifying that the first workflow has the given sub-workflow as a contained process.

    • Method Detail

      • getWfHasDataLink

        Set<DataLink> getWfHasDataLink()
        This property is used to specify the wfdesc:DataLink instances of a given wfdesc:Workflow.

      • setWfHasDataLink

        void setWfHasDataLink(Set<? extends DataLink> wfHasDataLink)
        This property is used to specify the wfdesc:DataLink instances of a given wfdesc:Workflow.

      • getWfHasSubProcess

        Set<Process> getWfHasSubProcess()
        This object property is used to specify that the given workflow contains the given process as part of its definition. Although not a requirement, such sub processes should have wfdesc:DataLink within the containing workflow connecting their parameters with parameters of the containing workflow, or with parameters other contained wfdesc:Process instances. A specialialisation of sub process is wfdesc:hasSubWorkflow where the sub process is a nested wfdesc:Workflow.

      • setWfHasSubProcess

        void setWfHasSubProcess(Set<? extends Process> wfHasSubProcess)
        This object property is used to specify that the given workflow contains the given process as part of its definition. Although not a requirement, such sub processes should have wfdesc:DataLink within the containing workflow connecting their parameters with parameters of the containing workflow, or with parameters other contained wfdesc:Process instances. A specialialisation of sub process is wfdesc:hasSubWorkflow where the sub process is a nested wfdesc:Workflow.

      • getWfHasSubWorkflow

        Set<Workflow> getWfHasSubWorkflow()
        This object property is used to associate a wfdesc:Workflow description to another wfdesc:Workflow, specifying that the first workflow has the given sub-workflow as a contained process. This is a specialisation of wfdesc:hasSubProcess.

      • setWfHasSubWorkflow

        void setWfHasSubWorkflow(Set<? extends Workflow> wfHasSubWorkflow)
        This object property is used to associate a wfdesc:Workflow description to another wfdesc:Workflow, specifying that the first workflow has the given sub-workflow as a contained process. This is a specialisation of wfdesc:hasSubProcess.
